org.grails.datastore.gorm
[Groovy] Class GormStaticApi

java.lang.Object
  org.grails.datastore.gorm.AbstractDatastoreApi
      org.grails.datastore.gorm.AbstractGormApi
          org.grails.datastore.gorm.GormStaticApi

@groovy.transform.CompileStatic
class GormStaticApi
extends AbstractGormApi

Static methods of the GORM API.

Parameters:
- the entity/domain class

Parameters:

findOrCreateWhere

D findOrCreateWhere(java.util.Map queryMap)
Finds a single result matching all of the given conditions. Eg. Book.findWhere(author:"Stephen King", title:"The Stand"). If a matching persistent entity is not found a new entity is created and returned.
Parameters:
queryMap - The map of conditions
Returns:
A single result

findOrSaveWhere

D findOrSaveWhere(java.util.Map queryMap)
Finds a single result matching all of the given conditions. Eg. Book.findWhere(author:"Stephen King", title:"The Stand"). If a matching persistent entity is not found a new entity is created, saved and returned.
Parameters:
queryMap - The map of conditions
Returns:
A single result

findWhere

D findWhere(java.util.Map queryMap)
Finds a single result matching all of the given conditions. Eg. Book.findWhere(author:"Stephen King", title:"The Stand")

Returns:
A single result

findWhere

Finds a single result matching all of the given conditions. Eg. Book.findWhere(author:"Stephen King", title:"The Stand")
Parameters:

args - The Query arguments

first

D first()
Finds the first object using the natural sort order
Returns:
the first object in the datastore, null if none exist

first

D first(java.lang.String propertyName)
Finds the first object sorted by propertyName
Parameters:
propertyName - the name of the property to sort by
Returns:
the first object in the datastore sorted by propertyName, null if none exist

first

D first(java.util.Map queryParams)
Finds the first object. If queryParams includes 'sort', that will dictate the sort order, otherwise natural sort order will be used. queryParams may include any of the same parameters that might be passed to the list(Map) method. This method will ignore 'order' and 'max' as those are always 'asc' and 1, respectively.
Returns:
the first object in the datastore, null if none exist

get

D get(java.io.Serializable id)
Retrieves and object from the datastore. eg. Book.get(1)

last

D last(java.util.Map queryParams)
Finds the last object. If queryParams includes 'sort', that will dictate the sort order, otherwise natural sort order will be used. queryParams may include any of the same parameters that might be passed to the list(Map) method. This method will ignore 'order' and 'max' as those are always 'asc' and 1, respectively.
Returns:
the last object in the datastore, null if none exist

Executes the closure within the context of a new transaction
Parameters:
callable - The closure to call
Returns:
The result of the closure execution
See Also:
withTransaction(Closure)
withTransaction(Map, Closure)
withNewTransaction(Map, Closure)

withNewTransaction

java.lang.Object withNewTransaction(java.util.Map transactionProperties, groovy.lang.Closure callable)
Executes the closure within the context of a new transaction which is configured with the properties contained in transactionProperties. transactionProperties may contain any properties supported by org.springframework.transaction.support.DefaultTransactionDefinition. Note that if transactionProperties includes entries for propagationBehavior or propagationName, those values will be ignored. This method always sets the propagation level to TransactionDefinition.REQUIRES_NEW. 
 SomeEntity.withNewTransaction([isolationLevel: TransactionDefinition.ISOLATION_REPEATABLE_READ]) {
     // ...
 }
Parameters:
transactionProperties - properties to configure the transaction properties
callable - The closure to call
Returns:
The result of the closure execution
See Also:
org.springframework.transaction.support.DefaultTransactionDefinition
withNewTransaction(Closure)
withTransaction(Closure)
withTransaction(Map, Closure)

withSession

java.lang.Object withSession(groovy.lang.Closure callable)
Execute a closure whose first argument is a reference to the current session.
Parameters:
callable - the closure
Returns:
The result of the closure

withStatelessSession

java.lang.Object withStatelessSession(groovy.lang.Closure callable)

withTransaction

java.lang.Object withTransaction(groovy.lang.Closure callable)
Executes the closure within the context of a transaction, creating one if none is present or joining an existing transaction if one is already present.
Parameters:
callable - The closure to call
Returns:
The result of the closure execution
See Also:
withTransaction(Map, Closure)
withNewTransaction(Closure)
withNewTransaction(Map, Closure)

withTransaction

java.lang.Object withTransaction(java.util.Map transactionProperties, groovy.lang.Closure callable)
Executes the closure within the context of a transaction which is configured with the properties contained in transactionProperties. transactionProperties may contain any properties supported by org.springframework.transaction.support.DefaultTransactionDefinition. 
 SomeEntity.withTransaction([propagationBehavior: TransactionDefinition.PROPAGATION_REQUIRES_NEW,
                             isolationLevel: TransactionDefinition.ISOLATION_REPEATABLE_READ]) {
     // ...
 }
Parameters:
transactionProperties - properties to configure the transaction properties
callable - The closure to call
Returns:
The result of the closure execution
See Also:
org.springframework.transaction.support.DefaultTransactionDefinition
withNewTransaction(Closure)
withNewTransaction(Map, Closure)
withTransaction(Closure)

withTransaction

java.lang.Object withTransaction(org.springframework.transaction.TransactionDefinition definition, groovy.lang.Closure callable)
Executes the closure within the context of a transaction for the given org.springframework.transaction.TransactionDefinition
Parameters:
callable - The closure to call
Returns:
The result of the closure execution
